Posts.Content: Hi all Im going on holiday in the morning and was just wondering, is it ok to go swimming whilst your having chemo??? Ive left it to late to  seek advice from oncologist.  Thanks in advance x
Posts.Title: swimmimg whilst having chemo

Posts.Content: No i wasn't given a strap. Had a softie to wear in my bra to hide the fact i only have one breast. New consultant had referred me to a plastic surgeon for a 2nd opinion. I want the expander to be repostioned but apparently that us difficult to do because of scar tissue. I told him i wouldnt be having expander filled as it is hecause it will make me feel worse about myself than i do already
Posts.Title: breast expander has moved

Posts.Content: Hi all I visited the breast clinic today with a view to start having my expander filled to start giving me some shape now that i have finished chemotherapy. My breast consultant that i was under has left so i got to meet my new consultant today for the first time. After examining me, he informed me that the expander had moved so now once it has been filled it will look abnormal. My old consultant has never once mentioned to me that the expander had moved. I am now thinking that is why he was reluctant to fill it and adviced me to wait untill chemotherapy was over. Has anyone else had problems with expanders moving?? Tia
Posts.Title: breast expander has moved

Posts.Content: Hi all Due to have first chemo session this thursday. How do i add this link to my favourites?  Thanks x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply. Glad you getting on ok with yours. Ive had nothing but problems from the start. Today was a total shock. Thought now chemotherapy was over i would be able to start getting back to normal and feeling like me again
Posts.Title: breast expander has moved

Posts.Content: Thanks dreamthief Think it because im using smartfone im not getting that option.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi helen Sorry to hear that you are experiencing complications. I had  a mastectomy  on the 7th of april and 2 weeks later my wound also turned necrotic. I had an operation to remove  the dead tissue and one week later the wound was not healing and had opened up. My consultant didnt want to rush to theatre and remove the expander unless it was the last resort. I had a vacuum assisted dressing applied called a pico. This was changed twice a week and was stopped altogether last week. My wound has almost healed now and i will be starting chemo next week. With all of the above surprisingly my chemo was delayed by only 2 weeks.  I didnt realise until I went through this how common necrosis after a mastectomy was x
Posts.Title: Necrosis after bilateral and tissue expander

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply dreamthief. Im really well thank u. I had fec then t. Im taking herceptin and tamoxifen. And as for my hair....im doing a good impression of a monk. Its growing really well on the sides, growing sparingly at the back and nothing on top!!!!!! X
Posts.Title: hair growth aftet chemo

Posts.Content: Im abit worried now about it i must say. Im not due to see oncologist now until January and have no appointments booked with breast consultant until ive been reviewed by plasic surgeons ao looking at jan again at the earliest.
